meanings.sent1: After the rain washed away the oil, they decided to reanoint the statue.
meanings.sent2: She had to reanoint the door hinges to stop them from squeaking.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful wizard had to reanoint the magical sword for the third time that week.
meanings.sent4: The artist felt the need to reanoint her masterpiece with fresh paint.
meanings.sent5: The gardener would reanoint the plants with fertilizer every month.

meanings.definition: To apply oil or ointment again.
meanings.sent1: The athlete had to reanoint his muscles after the intense workout.
meanings.sent2: She would reanoint her dry skin with lotion every night.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally forgot to reanoint the pan with butter, causing the food to stick.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic knew he had to reanoint the gears to keep the machine running smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The mother would reanoint her child's scraped knee with antiseptic cream.

meanings.sent1: The priest was asked to reanoint the sacred relics during the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: They decided to reanoint the church altar on its anniversary.
meanings.sent3: The king requested to reanoint his crown for good luck.
meanings.sent4: The elders gathered to reanoint the ancient temple after its restoration.
meanings.sent5: The shaman would reanoint the tribal artifacts with special herbs and oils.
